column4: Amarok crashed on my, and I have amarokapp <defunct> still in my process list, how do I kill it? I tried kill -s 9 but it didn't do anything.
zombie ?  select to order by dependencies and kill the parent process
kill what though? that's the only thing in the list thats related to amarok I think.
how are you getting the list ? top ?  try the system monitor in the system > admin menu
Can't kill it from System monitor, I guess I have to restart then?
from the system monitor,  check inthe display options to have displyed by dependencies
no not kill the dep , kill the parrent  you might have to select view all processes
it's parent is amarokapp, I can't kill it.
I guess you'll have to restart then
try ls > filename that might out put a text file with the content, not sure it if work s
That's not what men, sorry for not making it clearer, I want the entire directory listing up to the file like /home/user/folder/file.txt and to do that >> to a file.
the command "ls" will list the content of the folder, ifyou want to see what is in a file you need to open that file,  if it is a text file  use gedit , or nano ,   nano /path/filename
I know, I give up, I'll just do the entire directory listing to the file by hand,I was hoping for something easier. but It's fine.
open a terminal,   cd to the folder you want  type ls > content.txt ,  then type nano conten.txt
Yeah I did it this way pwd >> ~/file.txt && ls >> ~/file.txt and combined them in vim. lol I suck.
